Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: irashnl
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in a deluxe room and now wish we'd stayed longer. Great hotel, certainly puts many 5 star hotels to shame. Had the best dining experience we've had in a long time at the hotel restaurant (Fonda), service was impeccable and the meal was amazing. Great location, room was large and modern without fault. Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large and well equipped (shower is amazing). 20 mins to the airport, walking distance to most tourist spots in old Barcelona and the hop on hop off bus tours (which could then take you further afield). Free wifi would be nice, we stayed in a hostel for a couple of nights and at $40 p/night they managed to provide free internet. This seems to be rare for hotels these days though, so not a major problem. There is a fair bit of activity on the back streets around the hotel at night, so could be a good idea to bring earplugs if you sleep lightly. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Barcelona we were part of a Family group on a Weekend +Monday trip. The Hotel was booked by my Sister-in-Law,(Thanks Rose) and it turned out a very good experience.most all the people that i told that we were going to Barcelona said to be very careful because of muggings and pickpockets,we did not see any theft through out our stay,i even commented to friends that there are more Police sirens back home than here.I even ventured out fairly early for a stroll(7.45am) and did not feel anyway threatened,its also the best time to see things(hardly anybody about). The Hotel is ideally situated for walking as its only about a 100yds from the Ramblas and a short walk gets you to the Harbour area,where you can get some food and people watch.Food is a bit on the expensive side but as all Big Cities charge more you just have to accept it.The Hotel room we were in was on the front of the Hotel directly over the entrance overlooking the street,to me it was ok i like to hear whats going on but one of the other members of our party was a bit upset at being woken in the night to shouting and singing,but you are in a City and i only heard any noise once when needing the toilet,but got to sleep straight away.The room was very quiet no creaking floors or heating/water noises,in fact the room was very warm to warm for me but the Wife likes hot so i have to sweat,you can dial in the temp you want on the control panel by the door,just a comment about the heating,all the power to lights etc is controlled by placing the credit card that opens the door into a slot and then all the light etc work,when you go out the room and take the card out,when you come back in and replace the card the heating sets to a default eg 22c,i found out when trying to get to sleep i was way to hot,just need to dial in lower setting,the room was great,clean and functional,shower was brilliant the biggest i have been in.We did not try the breakfast meal so cannot comment,but the bar was good, average price and you could watch television or talk.The staff as has been said before are friendly and helpful even opening the Hotel door at times,also must add on that the Rituals bathroom soaps and shower items are really good have even looked up our local supplier to get top up supplies.We will be visiting Barcelona again but later in the year as April can be cool and we will be booking this Hotel.When reviewing any holiday you tend to pick up on the low points and everybody will have them whether its the airport/the place/hotel/ so its a balance, you hear horror stories all the time but mostly its only minor niggles and as this one stands out as one of the good ones,as a footnote it amazed me on walking about i noticed that they have a cycling hire system called Bicing which as i later found out you subscribe to and i think it was 20 euro`s per year and it gives you access to these cycles that are placed all over the city which you can pick up and drop off in designated locations all over the city and best of all i did not see any vandalised ,they tried this in the UK but all the bikes were nicked.All in all a very good Hotel and City to visit we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Charm of Espanya...”
Reviews.Author: Nikki L
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is conveniently located near Las Ramblas where one can walk to almost anywhere in Barcelona. I strongly recommend staying here for the following reasons. The rooms are furnished in a contemporary style of earth tones with all the conveniences of home. It features: WIFI, telephone, TV, mini bar , however, one rarely stays in the room only to change in the evening to go out.. The bathroom is quite spacious with a large shower (great) and the closet is enough for two for a couple of days. A safe is available to store your passport and other important documents, nevertheless, you don't have to worry about theft. The design of the hotel is very unique as it has both a old and new feel, with embellishments of various styles. Once you enter into the hotel, you think...modern but strange as it is rectangular in shape and the lobby is on the other side of the reception. It is quite small but useful while waiting for friends. You can see the breakfast area and dining room through the giant glass doors, although, we never ate at the hotel, I'm sure it's convenient for families. There is a bar and a comfortable living room area next to the bar (away from the reception) so one can gab with friends or have a cocktail before going out or enjoy a nightcap before retiring. The staff is professional but rather impersonal...which I thought was strange for Spaniards, however, these are Catalan, they are quite different so don't expect them loud boisterous. The hotel is a rather quiet and peaceful of which I highly recommend. Overall: Rooms: Some might find it small but it is very convenient and clean. Showers & toilet: wonderful Food: We never ate there since restaurants abound near the hotel. SPA/gym: none Pool: none Reception: professional Bar: reasonable but some say pricey Price: OK, for a hotel of this caliber, however, its a bit pricey for some Location: Perfect If you are looking for convenience and location then this is the place to be. It is not a grand hotel but it is perfect for your first visit to Barcelona. I have been here many times and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel but a couple of points to note”
Reviews.Author: Moof
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully designed hotel with some wonderful touches....... If you prefer hotel which isn't grand but has a cool but stylish vibe to it then Espana should fit the bill Location is great 2 mins from the rambles and 5 mins from placa reale or boqueria market Breakfast was fine with the usual continental fair and you have options to pay a few euros for cooked eggs ! service throughout my wife's and my stay was pleasant enough and bar is not overpriced.... Bottle of cava for eur20 is pretty ok for a hotel However a few points to note ...... The standard rooms are woefully small, you literally have about 8 inches from the end of the bed to the desk/tv .... So very claustrophobic.... I didn't see the rooms but would suggest upgrading (although beds were firm and showers were good) Also noise levels not great ..... Rooms at rear of hotel suffer from local residents (not their fault but just consequence of backing onto people's backyards !) and as central access to rooms is in a glass enclosed atrium you can hear everyone's doors opening / shutting Would I stay again .... Yes but I'd be selective on the room ..... And bring earplugs !

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: rapeat
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from and excellent stay. we had a lovely room very comfortable and cosy. The bathroom was good the only negative would be that the shower door didn't open very wide as it hit the sink, but the toilet was like being on a throne! And tthe rituals bath products are fantanstic! I can not praise the staff highly enough they were superb, from ringing lost property at the bus company when my phone was stolen to opening the doors for you as you enter the building! The location cannot be betten as it is just off la ramblas and the road is oposite the metro so is in easy walking or metro from all of barcelona and just around the corner from palau guell and the bocqueria .market

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: PG66
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, just a minute from Ramblas but very quiet for such a central location. Very modern with a relaxed atmosphere. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Spacious room and bathroom which great standard of cleanliness. Would definitely consider staying again as you couldn't be any closer to the hub of Barcelona and yet only a short stroll to the seafront.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Norwagabond
Reviews.Content: A fully refubished hotel in an interesting historic building (check out their web page for details) Very good service, and the location is unbeatable, 30 seconds walk from La Rambla. SDtaff was friendly, helpful and efficient. Stayed in a room with a balcony facing the street, an excellent choice, for soaking up the atmosphere of the city. Will definitely recommend this hotel. And make sure you don't miss the fireplace in the hotel bar ! It does need a Wi-Fi upgrade, like so many other hotels. Internet should be free for paying guests and with sufficient bandwidth. A little tip: The best way to explore Barcelona is by bicycle. The bicycle rental shop (Budget Bikes) on the next block has some good offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and beautiful unusual design in top location”
Reviews.Author: GrantRichard
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly, efficient and professional. Decor and design fantastic a pleasure to be in and just sit and drink a bit. The restaurant was superb with Vidal giving us a great personal and professional service, even if you don't stay at the hotel it is worth going to the restaurant to dine and soak up the decor and atmosphere. Only one small negative point - the rooms are small, maybe this is the standard of all hotels in old European cities but for older people it is difficult to move between the bed and desk and to turn the lights out when the switches are squashed against the bed sheets. This size should be kept as a single or queen but not a twin. For the present older traveller luxury must also include spaciousness.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Edward N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an ideal location with a Metro station a few hundred yards from the front door on La Rambla. The hotel has retained many original features and the marble fireplace in the lounge bar was stunning. Although the hotel offers free Wi-fi in public areas the facility was difficult to connect to. Other guests experienced the same problem. We only ate breakfast in the hotel on one occasion as it was offered at a special price of €13.50, however we wished that we hadn't bothered it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ciao8055
Reviews.Content: Hotel Espana is a beautiful hotel and great location to walk to a lot of different places. Our hotel room was contemporary and gorgeous but too small. We arrived in Barcelona with a lot of luggage after a 10 day cruise and we didn't have much room in the hotel room to get comfortable. So, we went to the roof top lounge which was excellent. One day, we took the open top bus tour which was a great way to see some of the sites that are not within walking distance. Great tapas but this city seemed to be way too crowded for my personal taste, reminded me of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jillby55
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is a rare breed. It actually looks better than it does on its own website whereas others just have one interesting chandelier or staircase. Every corner was a new example of exceptional craftsmanship. On top of all this it's extremely convenient and always easy to locate as it's next to the Liceu.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Laura2780
Reviews.Content: As we walked into the lobby, I had to check was actually was the hotel we'd booked...it was stunning. The location couldn't be more perfect for discovering Barcelona. The interior of the hotel was amazing, as was our room. The Rituals toiletries smelt so good. The staff were very helpful. We did not have 1 complaint about our stay at this hotel and would definitley go back.

Reviews.Title: “How can I give it a better score?”
Reviews.Author: Helenor R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is BRILLIANT, and we're really fussy!!! From the excellent welcome and introduction to my room to the staff who try their very best to make you happy this place is great. And we haven't even mentioned the amazing interior and fantastic design throughout the hotel - exactly what Barca is all about. The location is also perfect, seconds walk from the Ramblas, minutes from the rest of the best Barca sites. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish rooms, impressive settings but...”
Reviews.Author: Alphonse C
Reviews.Content: Opera lovers and fans of the Liceu (situated literally next door) will love this Barcelona hotel. The stylish rooms and dazzling modern art deco hotel settings are out of the ordinary. The hotel is clean the staff generally friendly. Alas this did not fully offset the absurdly small size of our 1st floor room, its lack of natural lighting (window faced a wall), its relatively poor sound proofing (loud chatter in the courtyard at early morning hours), or the somewhat high wi-fi fares. This does not mean we will not return . If we did decide to give it a second try, we will triple check the size and situation of the room we're offered before we book.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff, Great Location, Very nice decor!”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very helpful and if asked at reception would look up the location of restaurants and other attraction and recommend things to see. The rooms were small but adequate! the bathroom was exceptional, with a fantastic shower! The location is fantastic about 100m from las Ramblas at Liceu Underground station which provides great links for transport!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: surinder j
Reviews.Content: I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city, it is fantastic! I was booked into the Hotel Espanya for four nights but unfortunately my time there was cut short due to a family matter. The staff were out of this world! They were really understanding, helpful and attentive and made the time a lot easier to deal with. The location is amazing and the hotel has under gone a fantastic restoration. We were in walking distance of beautiful theatres, great places to eat and short stroll away from iconic landmarks. For a short city break this place is ideal as you could cover a lot of ground being located so central. Truly excellent, thank you again and again for all of your help. Surinder Jandor

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel in great location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyBell
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week with a few friends. What a lovely friendly team. All very helpful and cheery. Nothing too much trouble. It didnt stop raining all weekend in Barcelona so as a result we made good use of the Hotel Bar. Very chique and comfy. Perfect for catching up with old friends. Interesting design blending old with new and lots of unusual features. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and the decor in public rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hemmo9
Reviews.Content: If you want free WiFi book on line it's complimentary! I agree with previous reviewers re the old guy on reception, however the other staff were incredibly helpful. We also ate in the restaurant and really enjoyed it. Good service and excellent food. I can recommend the Lamb with Black Pudding Stuffing. My wife had the Steak and enjoyed that too. It's in an amazing room although they could turn the lights down a little. Our room was very modern with great Bathrooms and Showers. We stayed in room 307 overlooking the street below. On arrival we thought this was nice, however the noise at night was not good. And it doesn't stop until between 3 and 5AM on a Friday and Saturday. If you want a good nights sleep don't take a street view room. this was our only issue with our 3 night stay. We had Breakfast with the locals at the local market every day, cheap and excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to very good, but needed some improvements: see below”
Reviews.Author: TTex
Reviews.Content: Pros: quirky, interestingly decorated, clean, right in the middle of everything, nice bar. But some cons:front desk (juan?) such a snotty, unfriendly man, talking to him was simply unpleasant. cab from Sants Station was a nightmare. he had no idea where the hotel was, and tried to kick us out at night 'near the right street' (but per iPhone, we were still 1.5 km away) so we literally had to argue with him to drive to Las Ramblas, and luckily the hotel is just a very short walk from the main drag (with luggage not so fun). the experience was stressful and cost about 20eu and the cabbie was sighing loudly and talking like he was doing us a favor. Not the hotel's fault, but says something about difficulty with location. Other cons: the 'alley' on which the hotel is located is a little scary, and just a block or 2 the wrong way, you will walk past hookers etc. No free wi-fi, not even in the lobby. Extremely, intensely small rooms, and we were very hot during the night, despite supposedly turning the AC on full-blast (no AC). With the window open, despite looking onto the interior, it was noisy. If you don't want to be in the 'center' of everything, I would not recommend this place. We stayed 3 nights, and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in the spirit of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CnPLadybarn
Reviews.Content: For the Barcelona Gothic experience this does not fail! We booked it knowing the area from previous visits and have no complaints of location (be worried about pickpockets, yes, but don't be put off just simply be aware and take care of your things). The hotel itself has been beautifully updated all in keeping with Domenec y Montaner's original conversion to a hotel. Don't miss the nearby Boqueria Market and don't bother the hotel's wifi as there are loads of nearby cafes where it is free - example is Cafe Opera, also good for breakfast! We spent 7 nights at this hotel and it was a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tallies
Reviews.Content: We had a great time - if you smoke remember to ask for a room with a patio - this is great to entertain your friends as well

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and building”
Reviews.Author: lisomi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 6 nights at this hotel which is very conveniently located: less than 5 min walk from metro station (Liceu), 50 mt from the Rambla, 50 mt from Barri Xino and 100 mts from the market of Boqueria. The building itself is worth a visit: it is in modernism style and it was designed by Domenec y Montaner himself, a piece of art! Personnel was professional and courteous. Our room was very quiet but also very dim, almost dark even during sunny days and very small -almost stifling!. We had paid in advance for breakfast (20€/pp/day) which is totally out of the market!!! NO GOOD VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY. I suggest you have breakfat there once so that you have the chance to admire the room where it is served: very well decorated with wooded carvings and some ceramics applications on the wall... this is really worth a visit. The remaining breakfasts can be easilly, joyfully and unexpensively consumed to the nearby market of Boqueria where you will find fresh fruits, fruits juices, tapas, sandwiches, coffee, tea... everything you need :)))

Reviews.Title: “Veer to the right out the front door...and beware the (temporary) scaffolding”
Reviews.Author: GringoWim
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel. I agree with the other comments here; the location is fantastic, as long as you don't turn left out the door of the reception area. Our taxi driver (inept) left us about 500 meters from the hotel up the Sant Pau street and we had to wheel our luggage to the hotel. Obviously not the hotel's fault, but I was propositioned by hookers, offered drugs, etc. walking to the hotel with my wife. Not a pleasant experience. That said, the hotel itself is some sort of historic landmark. Tour guides actually take groups to the lobby to show off the fantastic decor, which has been completely resotred and/or upgraded. The rooms are nice, not too cramped, with great modern bathrooms and "rain-shower" style shower heads. Cons: I found the street fairly noisy. Ended up buying earplugs after the first night. The hotel sits right off La Ramblas, so you get a lot of overflow traffic coming and going. Yelling and screaming at all hours of the night. 16 Euro for 24 hours of wi-fi is a crime. I can't figure out why these 4 and 5 star hotels don't just give away free wi-fi as a perk. However, my wife booked through the hotel site, which had a free wi-fi offer, so that was a help. However some friends booked through one of the internet booking services and had to pay for wi-fi. I also thought the 20 Euros for a very limited breakfast buffet to be highway robbery. Go up to the Ramblas, turn left and walk about 20 meters to Escribá, a classic Barcelona bakery and sweet shop, for your coffee and a croissant etc. In addition, the hotel is undergoing a remodel of the facade, and our windows had scaffolding and safety nets in front of them. Not that the view would have been anything spectacular, there is an apartment building right across Sant Pau, about 5 meters away from your window. Pros: Excellent location close to Ramblas and the Liceu Metro stop. Very cool rooftop bar with palapa/cabana style lounges. Our friends upgraded to room 503, on the top floor, which has a nice private deck. I think it was something like 30 euros per night more, and I would recommend it if you go when the weather is half-way decent. A cold beer or glass of wine under the stars is nice. The staff is also very helpful. I had a package sent to me from Italy and it didn't arrive until after I departed. José at the front desk expedited the forwarding of the package for me the day it arrived. I would definitely stay again! But would ask for a room without the scaffolding.

Reviews.Title: “loved you !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PETALITSA
Reviews.Content: everything was just perfect.the hotel is beautiful , very clean with excellent staff. perfect breakfast.very close to las rablas .ask for Flor or Nis at the breakfast room , Ann(receptionist) and Toni(belboy) at the lobby. thank you once more for everything .we had a great time and we will be back that's a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the end of August. The location is brilliant, 20-30 metres from Liceu metro station and La Rambla. Plenty of great tapas restaurants nearby. 10 minute walk to the harbour, 25 minute walk to the beach. The hotel itself was great. The rooms have been recently refurbished and they are very modern (slightly on the small side), comfortable and clean, bathroom was lovely as well. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the street but at night it was quiet with the doors closed (air conditioning was cool enough!!) and we didn't have a problem sleeping. Room was cleaned every day with fresh towels (even on a Sunday). Hotel staff were very friendly and happy to help. As soon as our taxi pulled up outside someone was there ready to take our bags in to the hotel for us. Taxi fare was around 25 euros to the hotel, this includes around 5 euros supplement charge for a suitcase. The rooftop terrace was open until 2:30 am which was lovely after a long day. The pool and Jacuzzi were nice extras, it is on the small side but was nice when you can't be bothered walking the beach. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel, we paid around 120 euros a night and I would happily pay it to stay their again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel just off la ramblas”
Reviews.Author: pfizerhead
Reviews.Content: stayed here with friends for a 50th birthday. staff very friendly and helpfull. had a bit of a mix up with the upgraded rooms we booked but this was dealt with very quickly. room had a balcony overlooking the street but was very quiet at night. roof bar was great. watched the barca v porto on a sreen projected onto a wall opposite[17 meters x 10 meters] fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: z00mer-b
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel and both were very comfortable. The location was great - mid point just off of Las Ramblas allowing us to walk everywhere. Being off the main street, the hotel was very quiet at night. The hotel also has a lounge on the rooftop which we found refreshing after a day out-and-about. The drink prices were very reasonable. Note: The swimming pool is actually a plunge pool (ice cold). I would consider this hotel to be suited better for couples rather than families. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we found the prices to be too expensive. The hotel prices were very good though. We would definitely reccommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!! definatley will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Fiona H
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel for a two nights stay and was amazed by where we picked to stay. stunning hotel and great rooms, large beds and bathroom. had a few problems with working the Tv and fridge but the hotel staff were vere friendly and always willing to help. service was FANTASTIC!!! we had been in a few bad places before barcelona so we were extrememly happy we picked a great place. The area is a little bit dodgy and we did not know where to go so turned the wrong way at night and ended up in the bad part of town but other then that i would definatly recomed. pool wasnt big but very nice and the decor of the pool area and bar was amazing. very modern! we booked when there was a sale on so 180 euro a night was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Akhula2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this small but beautiful and charming hotel! We stayed there 4 nights as a family of 8 people( with 4 children and grandparents) occupying 3 double rooms ( two of them interconnected) . The staff was very friendly and helpful ! The breakfast was simple but delicious. The location is very good- a couple of minutes walk to La Rambla and metro station. The air-conditioning works properly Special note: my mother forgot the jewelry in the room by departure. She found it out only late in the evening when we already left Barcelona. We called the hotel informing them and asking to check the room. Next day the jewelry was found and sent to the hotel in another city where we stayed!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: henningniss
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. very nice and spacious rooms (for a city hotel). The hotel and it's rooms are newly renovated. There is roottop pool, which is very small but still nice for a quick refresher after a busy day in the city. The hotel has a central location just off the Rambla. The street is somewhat shady, but we didn't experience any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, mediocre management”
Reviews.Author: Gigis_mum
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about staying at this newly renovated hotel but was very disappointed with the mediocre quality of their front desk. Management must be resting on the laurels of their parent hotel, the Condesa de Barcelona. We arrived, had lunch at the beautiful Fonda Espana and then waited a very long time for Miguel at the front desk to finish his phone conversation. He should have at least acknowledged us, standing in front of him, but he didn't. He just went on talking and talking. After many minutes, he hung up and started our registration. No apology or thanks for waiting. He addressed me by my last name without using a "Mrs" or "Senyora". It was as if he were a zombie. He didn't offer to call a bellboy to help with our big suitcases either. Another TA member mentioned a mix-up with the Wifi. Miguel tried to charge us for that too but I pointed out that I had booked the room directly on their website, which enabled me to get the Wifi for free. Every day, I had to call downstairs and ask for the new code of the day. The signal was so weak that we used the Wifi very little. This is not the standard of a 4 star hotel! During this trip, we stayed in more than 5 hotels and none of them charged for Wifi. Some of them were only 2-3 stars. The hotel has air conditioning in the public rooms but skimps on air con in the guest rooms. We had 2 vents but only 1 actually had cool air coming out. When we asked about a/c, the front desk sent a maintenance man up. He put his hand up near the working vent (but not the other) and pronounced everything in working order. I asked why the air current felt the same whether we had it set for High or Low. He didn't have an answer. The thermometer registered 19 degrees but it felt much hotter. The front desk confirmed that the room was 25 degrees (ie they have the modern technology installed to monitor room temperature). The shower leaked water all over the floor. The sink and shower basins were so shallow (3 inches at most) that dirty water often splashed back up. Whoever designed those fixtures probably never washes himself more than 30 seconds. The Bar Arnau is open only for breakfast and occasional in the afternoon. The day we arrived, it was closed by 6 pm. We were having a Tripadvisor party and we ended up entertaining on the roof terrace. The pool had been closed for several days before our arrival. It was tiny anyway. I'm glad we got a special advance booking rate of 110 euros (no b'fast). If I had paid 130+ euros, I would have been really dissatisfied. I had asked for a quiet room. Unfortunately, our room faced the balcony of a hostel and young people were partying nightly until past 4 am. Although there were 2 vents for air con, only 1 vent had a weak stream of cool air.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VladimirCY
Reviews.Content: Situated a minute walk away from the Las Ramblas, this hotel has an excellent location close to one of the main tourist streets in Barcelona. The rooms has very nice design, a mix of modern and classic styles. Everything was clean and we cannot find anything to complain about, although our stay there was just for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: LoveSunBeachMountain
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Espana has a cool history. It used to be a monestary and has undergone two major renovations. The first one was its conversion to a hotel in the early 1900s and the second one it is just completing. I think the pool is now operating which completes the overhaul. I was on a business/pleasure trip in Barcelona two weeks ago and stayed there for four nights. For ease of review for fellow travellers I will give a pro and con outline of the place: Pro: Great central location. Literally a couple of hundred yards off the Rambla right next to the Licea. 10-15 minute walk to the waterfront. Three minutes from the Boqueria market. It is on a narrow street and some travellers may feel uncomfortable late at night/early morning traversing to and from the hotel. We always felt safe but were also cautious. New decor and linens. Small but nice bathroom. Clean, with a big glass walled shower. There were plenty of soaps, shampoos, towels and lotions. Staff was friendly. The bartender chipper. Cons: Small room. The queen size bed (two twins put together) took up the whole room. If you sat in the chair in front of the desk at the foot of the bed a person could not get around you. Price. 240 euros per night. We got this room on only about a week notice. probably could have shopped around and got more bang for the buck. Although, the room was allegedly non-smoking, the room had either been smoked in regularly or the ventilation brought in cigarette smoke. We addressed this with the front desk and we were assured that the entire floor was non-smoking. Breakfast was very expensive. It would have cost about 40 euros per person. We were supposed to have internet service included in our price but when we got there we were informed we were mistaken. Internet service, which included cable tv was another 18 euros per 24 hours. I didn't argue about it, life is too short to fuss about stuff like that. There appeared to be some kind of issue with the bathroom venting. Conclusion: We chose this hotel because it had a roof top deck and pool. Unfortunately, neither were open during our stay and no mention was made of this on their website or when we booked the room. Some construction was taking place during our stay and huge drills reverbrated the entire building by 9 am some mornings. The restaurant and bar were nice but expensive compared to some surrounding restaurants. The decor and ambiance was cool. I would stay there again if I could secure a better rate, the pool was open and I could pick a little bigger and better ventilated room.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ScubyDoo
Reviews.Content: Just off Las Ramblas this hotel is in a perfect location. It has recently been refurbished where the main interior has kept its history and charm and the rooms given a total modern chic look. We booked a delux room with street balcony, and found it very spacious and comfortable. A little outside noise on a night, but having done so much through the day being exhausted I still slept well. There is a roof toop terrace, with small plunge pool, sunbeds with towels, settes and chairs and a bar.. perfect for relaxing after a long day. We booked on a room only basis as we like to eat out so can't comment on the food, although the restaurant looked very appealing. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about pool”
Reviews.Author: bonnagg63
Reviews.Content: A lovely stylish hotel just of la ramblas, which suited us down to he ground. We didnt see any sign of hookers or robbers as previously mentioned, and felt quite safe. Rooms were very modern and comfortable, however a litle noisy early morning with deliveries etc. If youre a light sleeper, ask for a room on the internal courtyard. Our only bug bear with this hotel was that we chose it for its pool, as we have a 3 year old. When we arrived we found that it was having work done to it and was not in use. We had emailed previously and reassured that it would be available in June. Our son was very disappointed, and it put a slight dampener on our few days in the city. Other than that, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Snatch & Grab blackspot. You will be robbed in front of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: poulto
Reviews.Content: This up-market hotel is situated in one of the worst snatch n grab blackspots in Barcelona. We arrived to see a man being robbed of his cell phone whilst the doorman looked on indifferently. The next day my girlfriend had her handbag ripped from her shoulder by a gypsy boy, right in front of the hotel. Then an older woman had her necklace snatched. The hotel denies all responsibility but foreigners going to and from this hotel are an easy and obvious mark. There is no on-site parking, so from the car park to the hotel, you have to run the gauntlet past gypsy boys waiting to rob you. The other end of the street is full of low class hookers.

Reviews.Title: “A catastrophic service”
Reviews.Author: SteveG56
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights, with a group of friends, and the service was the worst service ever! The Hotel is nice, but the satff is not competant, and no good service besides the room can be provided. It has a good location, although located in the hookers and dealers area, which can be quite anoying when coming back at night...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: steviep47
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona to collect a cruise and stayed a few nights before. I had tried various top notch 5 star hotels in Barcelona so tried something different. The Espana is a wonderful builing set just back from Los Ramblas. It has a fantastic innner courtyard and is quite boutiquee. Service was excellent with the staff being friendly and chatty, too often top notch hotels the reception staff can be a bit cold. The room was very modern and tastefully decorated and for the price I would definately go back there and highly recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Chic, smart and relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 52Asher
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Espana is about 50 yards down a side street off Las Ramblas. Incongruously another 40-50 yards further down the street there is a 'red light area't. Notwithstanding this we felt safe at all times here. The hotel has recently been refurbished in its original 'modernisme' style. it is light and airy; the fittings befit a four star hotel. Considering its location in the centre of Barcelona it is not overly expensive. However, eating in the restaurant is rather overproiced considering the excellent food that can be had in restaurants close by in Barri Gotic and La Ribera. The hotel has a rooftop swimming pool. When we were there it was being renovated and was therefore unavailable. As the swimming pool was one of the reasons we had chosen the hotel we were disappointed that we had not been informed at time of booking that it wouldn't be available. The reception staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: IpswichTrueBlue
Reviews.Content: Excellent position. Felt safe and we were travelling in a family group with my son who is 10 and husband's parents who are over 80.The staff were great, particularly Alex and Miren who both work in the bar. We had the express breakfast every morning which was 6euros each and plenty for us. Ate in the restaurant ,small portions but top quality.Recommend the chocolate souffle. Room was fine and the powerful shower was so good that my son had 3 showers on his first day! Only drawback - work on the rooftop pool had not been completed. Loved Barcelona and people were very courteous. Young people unfailingly gave up their seats to let my inlaws sit down on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and good value hotel in central area”
Reviews.Author: adelelc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on current reviews since it had received some bad ones before being refurbished. We were really happy with our room - we booked a deluxe as it was still a reasonable price (cheaper than some of the standard rooms from other hotels nearby) when booking in advance and online through the hotel's website, and it was a good size with two comfortable single beds and an amazing bathroom with a waterfall style shower, bathrobes and slippers. The room was quiet, and though it wasn't particularly bright (it looked out onto a small courtyard) it didn't matter as we only had to sleep there! It had a mini bar that was fairly empty apart from two complimentary bottles of water and juice, but sadly no tea/coffee facilities, which is always nice to have. We didn't eat in the hotel but it is close enough to the market and a little bakery/coffee shop where you can have breakfast. It's in the middle of La Rambla, literally 30 seconds walk from the tube station Liceu, and about 5-10 mins walk (depending on your pace!) from Placa Catalunya (where the airport bus goes) and the bottom of La Rambla where the Columbus monument is. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel and it cost just under 30EUR as the taxi will add on an extra few EUR per suitcase. Overall the hotel was clean, and had all the services you would expect. A lot of people had warned us not to stay in that area, and despite stories of muggings etc on La Rambla and the streets surrounding it we had no problems - the only thing is that the main street is very busy with street perfomers and people trying to get your money for some reason or another, but they can be avoided if you just keep walking...I can't comment on the pool as it wasn't in operation in May, which is normal for Spain, but the rooftop doesn't have spectacular views, so if you are looking for a view then it's best to try one of the taller hotels - this one only had about 6 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Espana”
Reviews.Author: wildlox
Reviews.Content: Great Location in the La Rumbla area, close to shops, piazzas and just a general buzz

Reviews.Title: “Pool not in use !!”
Reviews.Author: Redloverr
Reviews.Content: The main reason why we chose this hotel was the roof top pool. To our big disappointment they told us upon arrival the pool was not open and would only be taken in use in two weeks (beginning of June). Further saw on their website that there's free internet, but this is only if you book through their site. If you book through booking.com, then you need to pay extra (5€ for 30 min). It's not really what we expected for 160€/night without breakfast Except for the disappointments we had, the hotel is quite nice. - Modern & clean rooms. - Mini-bar, with daily 1 small bottle of water + 1 orange juice included - Great location - Bath room with rain shower. The personel could be a bit more friendly, but I guess their english just isn't good enough to deal with disappointed customers. We did not have breakfast included, and didn't want to spend 20€ pppd on that, and it also didn't look worth that kind of money. We always went in places around the hotel, on the Ramblas and in the Bocqueria, where you always have an amazing choice of fresh fruit (juices), Jamon Ibérico, ... We also spent some time at the beach (as we had no pool), which is a 20 min walk There we enjoyed the burning spanish sun and the nice beach bars. All in all, a great getaway, but next time, we'll take another hotel. I guess the pool is what would make it a 4 star hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Stunning new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jewels_Gva
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the hotel, in a standard room. The hotel has been completely renovated, and the decor is a stunning mix between history and modern amenities. The common areas are especially beautiful, and the bar area looks very relaxing. In summary, a wonderful interior design. The location is very central, in a small street directly off the Ramblas, walking distance from most touristic places in Barcelona. The metro station is a few steps away. We had a standard room, which was beautiful as well, although very small. However, the bathroom was wonderful, with a rain shower and a good size closet. Fine for one night, for more, maybe take a larger option. On the down side, the room was a bit noisy, as there are courtyards in the hotel, which reverbate sound from the lobby. We were also near the elevator, so we would hear people walking to their room. Breakfast is poor for a hotel of this quality. Not much choice, and very small. This definately needs to be drastically improved. The pool was not in service, and the terrace not arranged at all. They should remedy to that very fast, as the nice season is here. Service is very attentive, and all the personnel we saw were very friendly and helpful. In summary, we will probably go back and choose a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “What about the pool???”
Reviews.Author: saphoy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Espana. For the most part, I share the positive views of other reviewers. The room and bathroom were pleasant, the location was central. The common areas of the hotel are stunning. We were however disappointed by our stay for one particular reason. I had booked the hotel for my boyfriend as a birthday gift. His one request was that we go to a hotel with a rooftop pool so that he could have a morning dip. On booking.com and on the hotel's own website, it was stated that the hotel has such a rooftop pool. When we arrived (in May and 26 degree heat) the pool was in fact empty of water save for an inch of dirty rain water! We were, needless to say, extremely disappointed. We would quite simply have booked another hotel if we had been made aware that there would be no pool at the Hotel Espana during our stay. We were somewhat affronted that the hotel advertised such a facility with no specification as to the dates that it would not be available. May is hardly off season. It is for this reason that I have felt driven to write my first Trip Advisor review! Service at the hotel was generally fine but when we raised minor complaints they were not dealt with. The first was that the English TV channels in our room were not working, the second was that one of the bedside lamp light bulbs had gone. Neither of these issues were addressed despite our attempts to follow up. Not really 4* service but not exactly the end of the world. We were pretty disappointed that there was no free WiFi, when we asked we were told it was €16 for 24 hours, a bit steep in my view. We cannot comment on breakfast as we considered it too expensive (I think it was about €15 each per day). We went to the nearby La Boqueria market and had lovely breakfasts at the tapas bars there instead. The hotel itself is on a rather insalubrious alleyway off La Rambla. There were quite a number of dodgy characters about but as it was busy and well lit we weren't too concerned. The noise in our room wasn't bad in light of the very central location. Our room looked onto C/Sant Pau and we were only woken by revelry outside a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Geat hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LyndaIrv
Reviews.Content: Hotel Espana is ideally situated in a quiet side street about halfway down La Rambla. It has been recently refurbished and is very tastefully decorated. Our room was a good size - the en suite was excellent - fantastic shower. The only disappointment was that there were no tea & coffee making facilities. We were room only so I can't comment on the breakfast as we never ate there. Overall we were very pleased with our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel beside the Rambla”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the heart of the city within walking distance from the Rambla (100m). The location is more close to the harbor than to the Catalunya Place and despite the very noisy atmosphere of the famous Rambla, we had no problem to sleep in this hotel. The room was very good, design with flat screen and modern "rain douche" but was a little bit small (but for 2 nights it's not a real problem) We didn't take our breakfast in the hotel because it was expensive (more than 20eur/p) and went outside where there are plenty of places to have it. Staff of the hotel was helpful and try to help you if they've to. You find a metro station at 100m of the entrance of the hotel and the metro is one of the most easier way of transportation in this city (with the taxi which is not really expensive) Rate was about 140eur/room/night with booking.com

Reviews.Title: “A great introduction to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MervynLogan
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located hotel, beautifully finished, clean, friendly and helpful staff and well appointed public rooms. The barmaid - Miren - was a font of information and made several excelent recommendations for restaurants (e.g. Canete). Market nearby and eat breakfast there every day. Large bedrooms (Delux), very comfortable beds and little noise from outside accomodated a good night's sleep. Heartily recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaniLeo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very clean and very very confortable. Easy to get to city attractions and subway (nearby almost everything). The only thing that I didn't like is that the hotel is located in a narrow and dark street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottmills01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply stunning. We have just returned from a week stay at the Hotel Espana and had a truly wonderful time staying there. The hotel has recently been refurbished and had a complete change for the better. (See old pics on here) The staff are totally friendly and can't seem to do enough for you. The staff were falling over themselves to entertain and make our young daughter very welcome. From the point of entering reception she was handed a handful of sweets and was asked her name etc. The rooms are fantastic with everything you would need. It has a very boutique hotel feel and the bathroom is just great along with a very impressive shower. The hotel is situated 2 seconds off La Ramblas right in the centre of everything so your not far away from anything. Having the metro at the end of the road helps too as this is very convenient if your thinking of going on the metro. (highly recommended to get about) We didn't eat in the hotel apart from breakfast but the food we saw in the bar looked great. The breakfast was very good too and catered for everything. Upon booking the hotel we released that there was a small swimming pool on the roof terrace but unfortunately it was not filled with water. This was a little disappointing as we had told our daughter about it and she was excited about this. Maybe this was due to the season beginning to start. No big deal All in all this hotel is totally fantastic and can't really be faulted. If I was to draw on a negative. It would be that the windows need to be better insulated for sound proofing. As Barcelona is a lively city and being in the middle of everything you would expect noise but on our last night we did not sleep at all due to the noise in the street below. This could be seen as a huge drawback but this should not put you off staying at the totally wonderful hotel. We will certainly return but ask for a room on the inside part of the hotel and not on the Carrer de sant Pau. In a nutshell. This hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be back - amazing refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: linseyjx
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight, two members of cheery, well presented staff still on the desk. One escorted us to our room and showed us how to work everything, very pleasant and both spoke English fluently. We stayed in an executive room which had a comfortable king size bed, wide screen plasma TV, monsoon shower, double sinks in the bathroom, mini bar with bottled water and fruit juice (complimentary), desk, wardrobe and a safe. The room had a small balcony which looked out onto the street below, not much natural day light in the room but this didn't matter as we were out most of the time. No noise from the street, good double glazing! Lovely mood lighting in the room and air-conditioning which was easy to control. Fresh white dressing gowns and slippers were provided for each of us to use, made the stay even more luxurious. We didn't eat in the hotel, but purely because there was so much choice on La Rambla (1 minute walk away) Only complaint is that there was a half-empty bottle of juice in our mini bar. Also, the housekeepers knocked and came into the room at 9am despite having the 'do not disturb' sign up. The swimming pool was closed as it wasn't peak season - a shame as it was about 23degrees! Did not take away from the enjoyment of our stay - will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ambrosio93
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel. Great location, friendly helpful staff with very clean and comfortable rooms. I cannot think of any negatives!!!!! We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “really fab!”
Reviews.Author: swansbrook
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it has been very recently refurbished, is fascinating inside and is in a brilliant central location. We paid a bit more to get a suite which is actually a good size room with a huge bed and a fab large bathroom which includes a separate loo and shower and also incorporates a dressing room. It was inside facing with doors opening into the interior which sounds a bit odd but works well. We asked for fresh air instead of air conditioning. Staff were all excellent. Very friendly, helpful and efficient. Had dinner a few times in the restaurant which again was very good. Breakfast also good and plentiful. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, clean, central location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: biggyg
Reviews.Content: Very nice medium priced hotel centrally located off La Ramblas which is a busy main thoroughfare -plenty of places to eat, 10 minutes walk from the old gothic cathedral and all the little shops and side streets around. Very clean area, easy with the Liceu underground only 3 minutes walk away ( get your bearings when you come up out of the underground - the one exit is immediately opposite, the others are some distance. Hotel staff very friendly, helped with maps and advice. Room was smart and clean furnished in a modern style -Paid for internet 16 Eur for 24hrs, nice coffee shops open early so you dont need the breakfast. Receprion staff sold us bus tour ticket packs at a discount which was good and we caught the tour bus at the cathedral Suggest if you want to see the Gaudi Cathedral (the other one) you make a very early start as the queue was long! Very smart clean city

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: az2901
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the weekend. What a wonderful experience. The hotel was just renovated and the rooms were beautiful. the stairways were very stylish. The location is right off the center of the Rambla in a street that is blocked for cars most of the day so it was very quite. The rooms were OK size for this kind of location. We had free wi-fi. The staff was incredibly friendly (I guess they like kids!) and helpful. The bell-boy even gave me a 2-for-1 discount ticket when he understood we are going to the zoo... The only downsides were that I didn't have a kettle (which I needed for my baby) and I couldn't find how to activate the fridge. I could also here my children from across the hall when the door was open. At the check out they let me keep the room a few more hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JulianMVMills
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this newly refurbished hotel; was a bit suspect as thought it was a 2 start but it really is a 4 star. Fantastic location - about 50yds of the Ramblas. Great rooms (if a bit small) with everything you need, comfortable bed, good TV options streaming radio from UK. Ignore any previous comments about builders, they were almost finshed and did not impact our stay one bit. Agree with another reviewer aboiut the barman, Fernando, he pours a great G&T and his English is great and very helpful for directions etc.. (as were all the other staff). Would definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Espana
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer Sant Pau 9-11, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
